title: All types of visit
review: Beautiful place to visit.

title: Foy sagar
review: Foy sagar lake is nice lake.this ia beautiful artificial lake made by an Englishmen. This is good place for picnic

title: Not bad place
review: In India, a country with a hot climate, the water problem was always acute. In Gujarat (and Rajasthan too) it's solved using step wells. However, Ajmeri people chose the other way – dug artificial lakes. Foy Sagar lake, one of them, is located in eight kilometers from the city. Eventually they arranged the park and turned the whole spot into a tourist attraction, where you can come for a picnic, to watch beautiful landscapes of  Aravali mountain range and the sunset behind it. Unfortunately, I got to the lake at a different time and was deprived of the opportunity to see how the outlines of the mountains illuminated by the setting sun gradually sink into the twilight and on the earth, pushing  daytime parching heat, the cool air descends.

title: Foy Sagar Lake
review: Situated in the suburb of the city, the Foy Sagar, lake is an artificial lake envisioned by a great Englishman, Mr Foy. This synthetic lake was constructed in the year 1891, as a part of a dearth relief project and it is named after the architect who had supervised this great work.

title: Lake
review: Foy sagar lake is nice lake to see.good place for photography.my experience to saw this beautiful lake was awesome.

title: nothing to see or do here
review: Nothing to see or do here. They have created basic walking paths and garden but it's really not worth the visit.

title: Great...
review: It is an artificial lake. Just great to see lake from garden. We play some games, walk in the garden and take some rest.

title: Beautiful park of British era
review: THis is one of the favorite picnic place in the city. It is peaceful and maintained upto a considerable extant.

title: Nice place to hangout with friends and Famlity
review: Lake Foy Sagar is an artificial lake situated near Ajmer in the state of Rajasthan, India.

title: Avoidable
review: Once upon a time, Foy Sagar was one of the finest picnic spot in Ajmer. No more, it's park is I'll maintained, sheds are damaged, no basic amenities.

title: Once used to be a nice place for the kids, now just another spot
review: This place was one of the most attractive picnic spot. If you are too keen to catch a glimpse of past, you can come here. There are gardens with very little grass left. The shed, the rides, the whole structure needs serious maintenance. Too little water left in the lake. If you are going to Chamunda Temple, then you can stop in the way to have a look. Else you can avoid.

title: Beautiful sunset
review: Foy Sagar is beautiful and quite large in area. It has a huge park adjacent to it. Unfortunately,  not maintained. With a little maintenance,  this place can be a great hangout in the evenings. We had been there during sunset and the views were really nice.

title: Nice place to spend a Day off with Family
review: The Lake and the adjoining garden are a good picnic spot to spend some nice time with family and friends. You have to be careful though since the rides for kids are not too safe as they are not very well maintained. Also, there is lots of garbaje littered all around as the people are really not responsible or educated!! Its been more than a year i visited this place and with the Clean India mission going on, hope this place has improved on cleanliness grounds!! Rest, its one of the few open air places available to Ajmer People!!

title: Named after the engineer mr. Foy, artificial lake
review: Foy sagar is artificial lake created under a famine relif project 1892 and named after the engineer mr. Foy englishman.

title: No Water
review: Lake was almost dry. Nobody comes here. Avoid it. Just a lovely garden. May be for a small picnic for school children.

title: One of Ajmer's two big water body that attracts people
review: This lake was a beauty in its yester years but of late there is nothing much to crave about.  Water levels have receded and the lake looks a pale glow of its past. People do frequent this place often with their families.  There is a small park for kids to play around.

title: Nice Palace
review: It is situated on the way between pushkar and ajmer. Constructed by the english architect Mr. Foy in 1892 A.D, lake was named after him.

title: Near to Dargha
review: Its is very near to Dargha sheriff and just 2 km far from dargha. and there one Iceland in lake where the boat goes which has nothing much activity to do there but good time pass

title: Natural Beauty
review: This magnificent lake amazes the onlookers with its natural beauty.Due to its unique flat shape ,this lake looks like a pancake.This place can also be considered as a picnic spot.

title: a place to relax
review: you should go there in the evening. There is also a boating facility which takes you to an island and bring you back from there when you get bored of that place, it has a restaurant, rides for children, garden etc. Boat charges 100 Rs per person which is not worth at all.

title: awesomme evening at Foy Sagar !!!
review: really very intereseting place,u know some places ,more than the beauty the serenity of the places strike you.its really peaceful.huge lake,ducks n parrots !!! u will love to take a stroll in evening time with your loved ones !! boat facility is available that will take you to a park on other side.i think this attraction in ajmer is unmissable.enjoy your time in ajmer !!!

title: Foy sagar lake...awesome sunset view...
review: Foy sagar lake located in Ajmer around 6km form the railway station. We visited this place as it is situated close to our hotel named grand Xenia. It's with spending half hour here especially the sunsetting time. So just go visit this place at the evening hours and have an awesome sunset during your trip to Ajmer.

title: It is a picnic spot
review: When we were teenagers we use to go for a picnic at this spot, built by British official Mr Foy to provide water to the citizens Ajmer city this lake was build which is sarrounded by Arawali hills and during the rainy season water from the hills comes down to this lake, the best time to visit this place is during and after the rainy season from July to March month

title: Quiet Park and Lake away from madness
review: its a enjoyable place for a picnic . hope authorities give more attention on maintaining and building amenities.

title: Beautiful Lake ; Refreshing
review: The Lake is located between Pushkar and Ajmer, also referred as the twin cities separated by a hill. At the top of the hill travelling either ways, the Lake is easily visible and one can spot different species of birds migrating in winters.

title: You can Avoid
review: Foy Sagar Lake was built by an English Man Mr. Foy in 1892 under a famine relief project. The lake is just 8 km from Rly Stn. A small garden and some constructed flooring and pathway is there. The lake is surrounded by Aravali Hills. There are big grass and small plants in Lake. Needs much more cleanings. No other activtiy is there. Just to watch a shaby lake. An avoidable place.

title: Needs upgrade
review: visited during the winter season and the place is in serious need of an upgrade as well as maintenance. There are no caretakers and there is a lot of litter around. The lake itself is not very clean and lot more needs to be done to bring the whole place up to make it interesting for visitors.

title: "Nice View"
review: FOy sagar lake is very nice artificial lake in ajmer,It is named after the engineer Mr. Foy, an Englishman, who created it under a famine relief project in 1892.Very nice view of lake.

title: A nice and scenic family picnic spot close the to Ajmer City
review: I am a native of Ajmer and have a natural affinity towards Foy Sagar for multiple reasons! This has been a picnic place for the residents of Ajmer and other nearby areas and is definitely worth visiting for a family picnic. The site has very little covered space to relax close to the water so plan accordingly. Ensure that you carry a rug or something similar to sit on and have food especially if you are going with kids.

title: An evening out with the family
review: The place has been well developed. A good place for a picnic on a rainy day. However, you need to carry your own food, water, bed sheets to sit on, disposable plates/glasses and garbage disposal bags. However, the maintenance is very poor.

title: Veyr beautiful
review: Extremely serene setting though you dont need more than 2 hrs to see the placed around. Cab fare from the railway station is around rs. 100 - dont pay more.

title: lonely lake
review: aah.. lake is beautiful on the way to chamunda devi temple, amazing i was stayed for about 45 minutes there ..

title: beautiful lake
review: Very beautiful lake.  It is situated on the way between pushkar and ajmer at the top of a hill which becomes an interesting part for this lake. You will feel peace here and scenic beauty of the lake from the top of the hill makes it an incredible one.

title: Not worth during Summer
review: I was told it remains full of water during winter and rainy season however since I visited in April, it was pretty hot and the lake was almost dry with little water. I did not see any bird there. It is advised to avoid visiting this lake during summer.
